page.title: 08Attitudes to tourism
page.content: The Cornish use the word 'emmet' to describe the non-Cornish,or tourists.Every year,these flock to Cornwall in huge numbers to enjoy the rugged coastline,sandy beaches, traditional customs and mild climate. Tourism is a major industry.Many households offer Bed & Breakfast accomodation,whilst a youth camp under canvas is set up at Castle Gotha Farm. Young people from all European countries visit;especialy the French. The 'emmets' are welcomed because they have money,which generates jobs; and ensure that local communities are able to survive.On the other hand, tourist traffic blocks the narrow Cornish roads,they crowd small beaches or perhaps more seriously,they buy local property as holiday homes.Some villages are already becoming ghost towns during thw winter months.
